meanings.definition: To or toward (a point or limit)
meanings.sent1: She walked unto the edge of the cliff.
meanings.sent2: He ran unto the finish line with determination.
meanings.sent3: The cat leaped unto the table to catch the mouse.
meanings.sent4: The river flowed unto the sea, never looking back.
meanings.sent5: The sun sets unto the horizon, painting the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.sent1: The bird flew unto the tree for shelter.
meanings.sent2: The children ran unto the playground, laughing joyfully.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel scurried unto the nut hidden in the grass.
meanings.sent4: The wind whispered secrets unto the leaves, rustling them gently.
meanings.sent5: The river flowed unto the mountains, carving a path through the rocks.

meanings.sent1: Her success was unto her hard work and dedication.
meanings.sent2: His happiness was unto the love of his family.
meanings.sent3: The flower bloomed unto the care of the gardener.
meanings.sent4: The painting was unto the artist's emotions and experiences.
meanings.sent5: The growth of the plant was unto the sunlight and water it received.

meanings.sent1: She waited unto the stars came out in the night sky.
meanings.sent2: He practiced the piano unto the late hours of the evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat purred unto the food bowl was empty.
meanings.sent4: The child played outside unto the streetlights turned on.
meanings.sent5: The flowers bloomed unto the first frost of winter.

meanings.sent1: He worked hard unto achieving his dream of becoming a doctor.
meanings.sent2: She saved money unto buying a new car.
meanings.sent3: The team trained diligently unto winning the championship.
meanings.sent4: The chef prepared the meal unto satisfying the hungry customers.
meanings.sent5: The students studied diligently unto passing the exam.
